definition: to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
classifier for sheets of papers etc: pile, pad/Taiwan pr. [ta4]
firmly-based/steady/steadfast/to have peace of mind/free from anxiety/Taiwan pr. [ta4 shi2]
pedal (in a car, on a piano etc)/treadle/footstool/footrest/footboard
to have one's feet firmly planted on the ground (idiom); realistic without flights of fancy/steady and serious character
lit. tread the green; go for a walk in the spring (when the grass has turned green)/spring hike season around Qingming festival 清明, 4th-6th April
stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to interview people on the spot/to go around and make inquiries
to go and inspect (a site)/to do an on-site survey

sentences.english: the massive foot stomps down where he just was.
sentences.chinese: 机甲硕大的脚重重地踏在他刚才的位置上。

sentences.english: She skipped up flights of stairs to the tower.
sentences.chinese: 她一蹦一跳地踏着阶梯往塔上走去。

sentences.english: Slouches towards Bethlehem to be born?
sentences.chinese: 懒散的踏向伯利恒的投生？

sentences.english: Around the veranda paved with stepping Ishidan, leading to the top.
sentences.chinese: 四周廊子铺有踏磴，可通顶层。

sentences.english: I like to watch handsome goose-stepping soldiers, too.
sentences.chinese: 我也爱看英挺的军人踏正步。

sentences.english: He stamped on the sparks to deep the brush- fire from spreading.
sentences.chinese: 他踏灭火花，以免灌木林火蔓延开来。

sentences.english: To and fro on fallen petals, how can I bear treading?
sentences.chinese: 来来回回的踏着落花，我于心何忍？

sentences.english: But being accepting doesn’t mean you act like a door mat, either.
sentences.chinese: 不过，接纳也不意味着你就要像是一张踏脚垫。

sentences.english: Suddenly I hear singing from the bank.
Hundreds of people have been killed in a stampede during a Shi'ite religious ceremony in Baghdad.
sentences.chinese: 数百人死于挤踏在巴格达稀客人的宗教庆典期间。

sentences.english: The crown of pride, the drunkards of Ephraim, shall be trodden under feet
sentences.chinese: 以法莲高傲的酒徒，他的冠冕，必被踏在脚下。

sentences.english: The echo of a horse's hoof.
sentences.chinese: 马蹄踏在卵石上的回响。

sentences.english: The sound of footsteps beating down.
sentences.chinese: 还有万人齐踏的脚步声。

sentences.english: The steps have been ground away by the passing feet of many visitors over the centuries.
sentences.chinese: 这些台阶经过许多世纪众多游客的足踏，已经磨损。

sentences.english: He was swinging the two long and skinny legs and treading the muddy water with a clattering sound.
sentences.chinese: 他撩开两条瘦长的腿，扑踏扑踏地踩着泥水走着。

sentences.english: He was swinging the two long and skinny legs and treading the muddy water with a clattering sound.
sentences.chinese: 他撩开两条瘦长的腿，扑踏扑踏地踩着泥水走着。

definition: to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
stride/to step (on the spot)/to mark time/at a standstill
to step on/to tread/to stamp/to press a pedal/to pedal (a bike)/(online) to downvote
you (used to a superior or between persons of the same generation)/below the foot
to mount (a horse, bike, flight of stairs, rickshaw etc)
